url.title: URL
url.description: The URL of the glTF model.

startTime.title: Start time
startTime.description:
The start time, as an ISO8601 string, to use when this catalog item is active
on the timeline. The time affects things like lighting and shadows. The

stopTime.title: Stop time
stopTime.description:
The stop time, as an ISO8601 string, to use when this catalog item is active
on the timeline. The time affects things like lighting and shadows. The

initialTimeSource.title: Initial time source
initialTimeSource.description:
The value of the animation timeline at start. Valid options in config file are:
    initialTimeSource: "present"                            // closest to today's date
    initialTimeSource: "start"                              // start of time range of animation
    initialTimeSource: "end"                                // end of time range of animation
    initialTimeSource: An ISO8601 date e.g. "2015-08-08"    // specified date or nearest if date is outside range

origin.title: Origin
origin.description:
The origin of the model, expressed as a longitude and latitude in degrees and
a height in meters. If this property is specified, the model's axes will have X pointing
East, Y pointing North, and Z pointing Up. If not specified, the model is located in the
Earth-Centered Earth-Fixed frame.

shadows.title: Shadows
shadows.description:
Indicates whether this tileset casts and receives shadows. Valid values are
'NONE', 'BOTH', 'CAST', and 'RECEIVE'.

upAxis.title: Up axis
upAxis.description:
The model's up-axis. By default models are y-up according to the glTF spec,
however geo-referenced models will typically be z-up. Valid values are 'X', 'Y', or 'Z'.

forwardAxis.title: Forward axis
forwardAxis.description:
Gets the model's forward axis. By default, glTF 2.0 models are Z-forward according to the glTF spec, however older
glTF (1.0, 0.8) models used X-forward. Valid values are 'X' or 'Z'.

featureInfoUrlTemplate.title: Feature info URL template
featureInfoUrlTemplate.description: A URL template that is used to request additional feature information for this model.
